title.narrative: Protecting the elephants of Mbam and Djerem National Park, Cameroon, through increased law enforcement

description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to conserve the elephants of Mbam and Djerem National Park through increased law enforcement. The project builds upon current work supporting the Ministry of Forestry and Wildlife’s (MINFOF) anti-poaching patrols and law enforcement management systems (i.e. MIST/SMART) by 1) improving capacity of judicial authorities to implement wildlife law and regulations, 2) building capacity of park staff to conduct law enforcement and ranger based monitoring, and 3) engaging park staff and community members in collaborative park protection efforts. Judicial capacity activities include: 1.1) Raising awareness of the judicial authorities on the importance of wildlife and the need for a rigorous application of the wildlife laws and regulations, 1.2)Producing and providing legal materials to the primary judicial authority, 1.3) Ensuring all cases of illegal activities identified are reported to the judicial authorities following standard procedures. Park law enforcement activities include: 2.1) Organizing refresher courses on wildlife offence statement development and judicial procedures, 2.2) Developing and implementing a realistic and efficient incentive scheme for ecoguards, 2.3) Planning, implementing and monitoring patrols and control missions in and around the park, 2.4) Ensuring efficient logistical support and provision of adequate equipment for effective law enforcement. Park and community activities include: 3.1) Sensitizing and encouraging the creation and official recognition of Village Based Park Management Groups in localities adjacent to national park boundaries, 3.2) Discussing and signing a partnership Memoranda of Understanding (MoU) with Village Based Park Management Groups willing to support the conservation of the park activities, and 3.3) Subcontracting boundaries clearance and tree maintenance to Village Based Park Management Groups via signature of an MoU.

description.narrative: U.S. engagement in Cameroon seeks to advance regional peace while encouraging development by strengthening healthcare systems. Foreign assistance contributes towards achieving these objectives by implementing programs that seek to strengthen the national response to the HIV/AIDS pandemic and increase the professionalism and effectiveness of Cameroon's military forces.
